36:00 The range guy is talking about ram pressure, it's proportional to air density and the square of the velocity. So even though the air density is going down as it climbs, that square of the velocity beats that so theres a hump in the curve of the dynamic pressure. After that point the air density, which follows an exponential relationship with height (exp(-ah)) gets so small it beats the growth of the velocity squared part.

2:02:00 love back to you from Beirut. I was planning to cover the Starship hop, but I needed to be donating blood. I was trying to understand with Scott Manley what happened, the pinkish orange smoke and the smell of Ammonia and dust. 135 killed so far (including 35 Syrian refugees) and thousands wounded. Imagine half of your capital city windowless. I was 3.5km away, the earthquake was followed 7 seconds later by a huge shockwave that broke all windows and hurt people who were trying to record or look at what was burning. 5000 wounded by glass, cars on the high way flipped upside down.
After a very terrifying day I watched your video of Starship after 2 AM.
